## Description {#details}

An opaque object representing a hash code.

This object represents the result of hashing some entity. It is intended to be used to implement hashtables or other hashing-based data structures. While it wraps and exposes a numeric value, this value should not be trusted to be stable or predictable across processes or executions.

In order to obtain the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hash-code">hash&#95;code</a> for an object &#39;x&#39;: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a0e2e479cf4860dc8a00614e36ee3d5e9">llvm::hash&#95;value</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">llvm::hash&#95;code code = <a href="#a3bae3ed52c5efcdd61eea5789ba14a9c">hash&#95;value</a>(x);</span></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

Definition at line 75 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/hashing-h">Hashing.h</a>.
